titleStmt.title: Staffords heauenly dogge: or The life, and death of that great cynicke Diogenes, whom Lertius stiles Canem Cœlestem, the heauenly dogge, by reason of the heauenly precepts he gaue Taken out of the best authors, and written to delight great hearts, and to raise as high as heauen the minds that now grouell on the earth, by teaching them how to ouercome all affections, and afflictions.
titleStmt.author: Stafford, Anthony.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by George Purslowe, for Iohn Budge, and are to be sold at the great south-doore of Paules: and at Brittaines Burse,

notesStmt.note: The first leaf and the last four leaves are blank except for rule border on F9-10.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Lacking frontispiece. Beginning-p. 5 from the Bodleian Library copy spliced at end.
